articles.title: Ceremony of Bidding Last Farewell to Kim Jong Il Held
articles.content:
Ceremony of Bidding Last Farewell to Kim Jong Il Held

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- A solemn ceremony of bidding last farewell to Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, took place in Pyongyang on Wednesday. 
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un together with senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs observed silence before the bier of Kim Jong Il, praying for his immortality, and went round the bier before the departure of a funeral procession. 
					
					 Then a ceremony of paying last respects to Kim Jong Il was solemnly held in the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK and supreme leader of the WPK, state and army, took part in the ceremony. 
					
					 Among the participants were senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Yong Chun, Jon Pyong Ho, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Yong Mu, O Kuk Ryol, Kang Sok Ju, Pyon Yong Rip, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Rak Hui, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop and other members of the National Funeral Committee, staff members of the Supreme Command of the KPA, commanding officers of the large combined units of the KPA, officials of the party and power bodies, social organizations, ministries, national institutions and the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media. 
					
					 The plaza of the palace was packed with servicepersons of the KPA, representatives of every province, people from all walks of life, overseas compatriots and foreigners to bid last farewell to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The guards of honor of the three services of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards and a column of soldiers holding colors were seen solemnly standing there. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un together with senior officials of the party and armed forces organs entered the plaza, walking by the side of the hearse, escorted by a column of soldiers holding colors of the KPA. 
					
					 The head of the guards of honor of the three services of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards made a farewell report to the bier of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The hearse passed by the guards of honor and the column of soldiers holding colors saluting Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The hearse, followed by motorcade carrying the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the members of the National Funeral Committee, headed for the streets crowded with millions of people of different social standings, servicepersons of the KPA and foreigners staying in the DPRK to bid last farewell to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The funeral procession threaded its way along the 40km-long route.
					
					 The hearse arrived at the place to be lain amid the last farewell bidden by millions of Pyongyangites and servicepersons of the KPA in tears. 
					
					 The head of the guards of honor of the three services of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards made a farewell report to the bier of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The guards of honor and the column of soldiers holding colors made a solemn salute to the bier before paying last respects to the leader. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un made a bow in deep reverence before the bier of Kim Jong Il, expressing deep condolences. 
					
					 The moment of placing the bier soldiers of the KPA fired 21 volleys of rifles and guns to mourn his demise. 
					
					 The guards of honor and the column of colors holders marched past, praying for the immortality of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony Kim Jong Un gave the senior officials of the party, state and armed forces organs important instructions to thoroughly implement the behests of Kim Jong Il, holding him in high esteem forever.

articles.title: Ceremony of Bidding Last Farewell to Kim Jong Il Begins
articles.content:
Ceremony of Bidding Last Farewell to Kim Jong Il Begins

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of bidding last farewell to leader Kim Jong Il began at the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Wednesday.

articles.title: Motorcade of Hearse for Kim Jong Il Enters Street
articles.content:
Motorcade of Hearse for Kim Jong Il Enters Street

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- A motorcade of the hearse for leader Kim Jong Il entered the Ryonghung intersection of Pyongyang.
					
					 The servicepersons and people of the DPRK are bidding last farewell to Kim Jong Il along the 40-odd km-long route.

articles.title: Millions People in Grief Bid Last Farewell along 40-odd km Routes
articles.content:
Millions People in Grief Bid Last Farewell along 40-odd km Routes

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The servicepersons and people bid last farewell to leader Kim Jong Il in heart-rending grief Wednesday.
					
					 The streets in Pyongyang were wrapped in great sorrow.
					
					 Streets extending 40-odd kilometers were crowded with millions of people who turned out to bid farewell to him.
					
					 They included servicepersons, workers, farmers, intellectuals, school youth and children and foreign friends staying in the DPRK were waiting for the historic moment, exposed to snow mourning the great man. 
					
					 As a motorcade of hearse for Kim Jong Il that left the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace amid the solemn playing of the immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Jong Il" entered Ryonghung intersection, bitter grief pervaded the street.
					
					 The motorcade was led by a car carrying a huge portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Last farewell-bidders broke into tears when his portrait came in sight.
					
					 The car with the portrait of Kim Jong Il was followed by a car carrying a huge wreath in the name of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK.
					
					 The hearse for Kim Jong Il slowly advanced.
					
					 His bier was bedecked by flowers and his coffin draped in the flag of the WPK.
					
					 The hearse was followed by a motorcade carrying the members of the National Funeral Committee.
					
					 Officials, workers, farmers, intellectuals and school youth and children bitterly wailed over the loss of the father who died on a running train. He worked heart and soul, having uncomfortable sleep and rice-balls and regarding military posts in the forefront areas and every place where people live as his office.
					
					 Bitter grief also pervaded premises in front of the April 25 House of Culture. 
					
					 People bitterly wept, saying they have never thought of the existence of Pyongyang and socialist Korea without him and crying, please don't go.
					
					 As the hearse entered Jonsung Square, men and officers of the three services of the KPA, students of Kim Il Sung Military University, Kim Il Sung Political University and other military and political schools at all levels and students of Mangyongdae Revolutionary School bitterly lamented.
					
					 They took off their military caps and bid farewell to the Supreme Commander in humble reverence, feeling painful at the loss of Kim Jong Il who performed undying feats in army-building which would shine long with the invincible might of the elite revolutionary armed forces, the army of the party and the leader.
					
					 The streets were full of pledges of loyalty to uphold the leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the WPK and the Korean people, with arms.
					
					 In Mansugyo intersection servicepersons of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and people's security workers burst into tears, unable to repress bitter grief.
					
					 The motorcade headed for Chollima Street through Pothongmun rotary.
					
					 An old man sank to the ground and bitterly cried, saying: General, the people are weeping. I want to take our General on my back. Indeed, I want to take on my back the General who is making the forced march. General!
					
					 Not only the elder people but youth and students threw themselves into pavement, unable to repress sorrow.
					
					 The hearse slowly entered Tongsong Bridge as if the General in jacket seemed to go anywhere with a broad smile on his face, not hearing the voices of the crying people. The moment the portrait of Kim Jong Il in jacket came in sight, the masses wailed and the routes turned into the sea of weepers. 
					
					 The motorcade of the hearse threaded its way through Phyongchon intersection in which major industrial establishments are located after passing through high-rise buildings standing like a folding screen.
					
					 People's lamentation rocked the heaven and earth as they had to bid last farewell to Kim Jong Il who always made journey to mix with people, saying he feels happiest when he is among the people.
					
					More than 100,000 farewell bidders packed the streets leading from Chungsong Bridge to the entrance to Raknang Bridge.
					
					 Working people of all social standings bid last farewell in bitter grief, recollecting with deep emotion the days when they received loving care and trust from the fatherly General.
					
					 The hearse threaded past Munsu Street overcome with grief amid the solemn playing of a dirge by the military band.
					
					 People who were paying last respects to Kim Jong Il in the plaza of the Party Founding Memorial Tower felt their hearts breaking apart.
					
					The motorcade crossed Okryu Bridge and entered Kim Il Sung Square that turned into a sea of weepers and wailers.
					
					 The square was packed with masses and reviewing stands were crowded with deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly, labor heroes, men and officers of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, men of meritorious service and officials of ministries and national institutions gave rein to emotion, looking up to the portrait of tender-hearted Kim Jong Il with smile on his face. Foreign friends also expressed deep condolences with great grief at the loss of the great teacher of mankind.
					
					 A huge crowd of people of all social standings greeted his bier in bitter grief in front of the Pyongyang Grand Theatre.
					
					 Wailing of people greeting and sending off the hearse in tears seemed to shake the land.
					
					 The motorcade rolled down at the foot of Moran Hill trembling in bitter tears of grief shed by tens of thousands of farewell-bidders.
					
					 The plaza of the Arch of Triumph was another sea of weepers and wailers.
					
					 Seeing the portrait of Kim Jong Il in jacket, people hardened their determination to build at an early date on this land a thriving nation where the desire of Kim Il Sung and the ideal of Kim Jong Il come true.
					
					 While the crowds evinced their firm pledges, the motorcade slowly rolled toward the Kumsusan Memorial Palace through the Friendship Tower and the Ryonghung intersection.
					
					 During his lifetime Kim Jong Il, wishing a bright future of the country being confident of the steady continuity to the Juche cause, said: As there is General Kim Jong Un, the future of the country and the nation is in safe hands.

articles.title: Snow Falls in Pyongyang before State Funeral
articles.content:
Snow Falls in Pyongyang before State Funeral

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Snow is falling in Pyongyang and many other areas of Korea Wednesday when the ceremony of bidding last farewell to Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean nation, is just to be held.
					
					 The feathery snowfall reminds the Korean people of the snowy day when the leader was born in the secret camp of Mt. Paektu and of the great revolutionary career that he followed through snowdrifts. 
					
					 It seems the sky knows well of how much he got snowed on during his uninterrupted field guidance tour for the happiness of the people. 
					
					 The snow that had fallen all night is still coming down, making the people recall all days and nights he spent for field guidance. 
					
					 All streets in Pyongyang and all towns and villages throughout the country are now inundated with people sweeping away snow before bidding their last farewell to the leader. 
					
					 They, who spent a sleepless night, missing him, have turned out in all roads covered by him in his lifetime.

articles.title: Koreans' Grief Gets Bitterer before State Funeral
articles.content:
Koreans' Grief Gets Bitterer before State Funeral

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean people's grief at the loss of their great leader is getting bitterer with the approach of the moment of bidding last farewell to him.
					
					 Kim In Jun, 54, who lives in Othan-dong in Central District, Pyongyang, told KCNA after visiting the mourning site for leader Kim Jong Il:
					
					 "I wish that all the past ten days were just a dream. How can I experience the heart-rending moment."
					
					 Kim Kyong Jun, an officer staying in the mourning site together with some twenty army surgeons and nurses, said: 
					
					 "The day has dawned when we have to bid our last farewell to leader Kim Jong Il. But mourners have not stopped to come here to mourn before a huge portrait of the leader with a broad smile on his face. Some of them have fainted, overwhelmed by the bitter sorrow." 
					
					 An Ri Ho, a 86-year-old woman residing in Kaeson-dong, Moranbong District, said, choked with tears:
					
					 "I had fainted while mourning here. I am missing leader Kim Jong Il so much."
					
					 Her daughter Kang Mi Ri, 53, said, "My mother owes so much to leader Kim Jong Il. She came here on foot. She refused to take a car, saying it is contrary to the filial duty. We will greet the day of the state funeral here in the mourning site where leader Kim Jong Il's huge portrait is displayed."
					
					 Many people are still converging on mourning sites in Pyongyang and all other areas of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (1)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (1)

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The servicepersons and people of the DPRK are at the most painful moment on Dec. 28 as they are bidding last farewell to leader Kim Jong Il, a peerlessly great man and father of the nation. 
					
					 National flags were hoisted at half-mast in streets of Pyongyang. Seen there are streamers reading "We mourn the demise of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will live forever".
					
					 The streets from the Ryonghung Intersection leading to the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to the April 25 House of Culture were crowded with servicepersons, citizens and school youth and children.
					
					 They are overcome with an indescribable sorrow as they have to accept this biggest loss as a reality though they can't believe. 
					
					 Among them are soldiers, old doctors who look back on the unforgettable days of happy life under his loving care and bitterly weeping school youth and students. 
					
					 The crowd broke into bitter lamentation as the motorcade of the hearse rolled into the streets.
					
					 "Fatherly General, don't go please!", "Never, never!" "Come back please!"
					
					 Even the land, rivers and trees seemed to tremble in grief at the sound of bitter cries made by servicepersons and people. 
					
					 They bemoaned, their knees on the ground, as they never thought of socialist Korea without Kim Jong Il and their existence without him.
					
					 They felt extremely regretful, looking up to the portrait of Kim Jong Il, his face sending a broad smile like the sun towards his beloved people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (2)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (2)

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) --"Comrade Supreme Commander, How can you leave us behind as you valued and loved us more than anyone else? We are calling you in chocking voices." 
					
					 Hero Street crowded with servicepersons turned into a veritable sea of wailing last farewell-bidders. 
					
					 They called Kim Jong Il, their voices chocked because of great regret that they would no longer be able to welcome to their posts the illustrious commander born of Heaven who performed great exploits to shine in the history of the country along with the shining course of the development of the powerful revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 General of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Rok (62) who grew up to be a commanding officer of the revolutionary armed forces under the loving care of Kim Jong Il lamented: "Oh, the General! I have not repaid your loving care even a bit. What shall I do as you are gone?" 
					
					 Ham Su Jong, 22, an officer of the KPA, lamented that she has never thought of this day, her heart seemed to break and she wished she had taken off her overcoat and covered the bier of Kim Jong Il with it as it is snowing.
					
					 Servicepersons of the three services of the KPA, cadets of military and political schools at various levels and students of the Mangyongdae Revolutionary School paid their last respects in the humblest reverence to Kim Jong Il, their military caps in hands.
					
					 The square of war victory was pervaded with the iron will to carry forward the Songun revolution which was started by President     Kim Il Sung and demonstrated victories under the commandership of Kim Jong Il as a history of steady victories, true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (3)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (3)

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Snow fell over streets nonstop as if the sky had shared sadness with the Korean people who grieve over the loss of the sun of the nation. 
					
					 "General, our father, it's snowing. How ardently we wished you safety while singing the song 'General, Do not walk on snowy day' whenever we had snow. General, how can you pass so untimely and so suddenly?" This chocking voice was heard from Chollima Street. 
					
					 Whenever it was snowing, people would worry if he was making a journey to the front. They wished him good health and safety, worried that he might push his car personally on a slippery road. 
					
					 That was why the people called so mournfully the leader who was born amid snowstorm in February and left them behind in snowy weather of December. 
					
					 Jo Sol Gyong (27), saleswoman of the Pothonggang Department Store, said in tears that they more keenly felt under what great leader they lived after losing the great father. 
					
					 She said: "Our General left nothing for himself. He dedicated everything, life and happiness to the revolution. 
					
					 "Still vivid in my memory is the kind-hearted General who had a broad smile on his face at our department store, pleased to see a modern commercial service centre serve people as required by the new century. The word 'people' sounds like his revolutionary legacy and this word reflects their wish for his immortality. 
					
					 The great Comrade Kim Jong Il lives forever in the hearts of the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (4)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (4)

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- An endless crowd of people including residents in Raknang District and Kangnam County bid last farewell to leader Kim Jong Il along the route of Thongil Street from Chungsong Bridge to Raknang Bridge. 
					
					 They grieved bitterly and missed very much Kim Jong Il, the lodestar of the country's reunification and the father of the nation, as he demised to the people's regret before seeing the day of the country's reunification so much desired by him.
					
					 Who could imagine this street overwhelmed with such lamentation over the greatest loss to the nation though it is the place which was alive with the spirit of our nation itself and which resounded with hurrah for independent reunification. 
					
					 It was Kim Jong Il who rallied all Koreans with his ardent patriotism and broad magnanimity and paved an avenue for national independent reunification, filled with the iron will to implement President Kim Il Sung's last instructions for the country's reunification no matter how often the sky and the earth are overturned.
					
					 The last farewell-bidders were overwhelmed with the irrepressible grief as they were paying last respects to Kim Jong Il, peerless patriot, while looking back on the immortal feats he performed for the cause of the country's reunification.
					
					  Jong Nam Chol, 45, chairman of the Management Board of the Songnam Cooperative Farm, Raknang District, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the great sun of the Korean nation who considered it as his lifelong mission to achieve the country's reunification.
					
					 The historic cause of the country's reunification is sure to be accomplished despite any storm and stress under the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who is identical to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (5)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (5)

					Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Youth Street in East Pyongyang is associated with footprints left by leader Kim Jong Il during his forced march for field guidance as he always devoted efforts for the improvement of the standard of people's living. 
					
					He visited the light industrial factories in this area including the Pyongyang Textile Mill and the Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory in his lifetime and made indefatigable efforts.
					
					The workers bid last farewell to Kim Jong Il as they effected a great surge in production, greatly honored and excited to welcome him to their worksites.
					
					Cho Ok Sun, 52, a woman worker of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, said: "General! I can never believe you passed away. General can not take leave of people. How lamentable it is. General can never leave us behind at a time when the appearance of a thriving nation in which the people will be well-off is at hand. We can't believe this loss."
					
					Ro Tu Nam, 31, workshop head of the Pyongyang Elevator Factory, said: It was none other than the General who made ceaseless forced marches for field guidance without a moment's rest by taking so much pain for improving the standard of people's living. I will contribute to glorifying Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses with increased production, considering his noble personality as a mirror of my life and struggle.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (6)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (6)

					Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il made sure that the best palace for babies was built with a huge financial investment, regarding the children as the kings of the country.
					
					 The hearse of the leader reached the street. Did he come again to see the babies he loved so much in his lifetime despite snow? They wished a miracle had taken place at that moment.
					
					 "General, do you hear those cries made by newborns? Where are you going after providing such excellent maternity hospital for our women and the generations to come?"
					
					 This is the lamentation of Ho Pong Chol, 54, a department head of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.
					
					  Jang Son Mi, a lady doctor, 31, said:
					
					 "We feel as if our General had gone asleep for a moment to relieve his fatigue pent up on the way of ceaseless forced march.
					
					 He seems to get up right now, when hearing the cries of babies. On the morning of December 19 when the 411th set of triplets were born we officials and employees decided to present a letter to Kim Jong Il if the 415th set of triplets are born next year, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung." 
					
					 This is not the story about them only.
					
					 A countless number of servicepersons and people of the DPRK have so many stories to tell Kim Jong Il who promised to meet them again next time.
					
					 Snow fell down on the grief-stricken streets in large flakes as if to convey so many stories.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (7)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always be with Us (7)

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Sung Square, the heart of Pyongyang, also turned into a veritable sea of wailing tens of thousands of people who gathered to pay last respects to leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Has anyone imagined this loss even in a dream? They have never imagined they would pay last respects to the leader at this square where they would break into rousing cheers towards Kim Jong Il, the great leader and kind-hearted father of the nation, full of immense excitement and joy and where they would watch the leader wave back to them, his face beaming with a broad smile. Could they think of the tribune of honor where he was not present?
					
					 The moment the motorcade of the hearse slowly entered the square, they broke into lamentation. They bitterly cried "General, Don't go, please" and "Don't leave us behind alone, please." 
					
					 Ra Kyong Hui, 30, a woman residing in Central District, wept bitterly: "General, open your eyes, please. Look at us even once, please. We can't believe you are gone. Get up, please."
					
					 Ryu Hwa Sun, 57, a section chief of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 who had the honor of receiving his field guidance in July, said with tears in her eyes:
					
					 "How can we bid last farewell to the leader as we feel we still hear the words said by him with joy, going round the goods exhibition hall in our department store. He is not gone. He can't pass. He is always with our people".
					
					 Many foreign friends present at the ceremony also mourned his demise, overcome with the great sorrow at the loss of the prominent great man of the world who made an immortal contribution to the human cause of independence.
					
					 At this hard time of paying last respects to the leader, people shouted:
					
					The great Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us!
					
					 He will always live with the people whom he loved so much all his life thanks to their yearning for him growing stronger as the time goes by. 
					
					He will always live thanks to the thriving nation which would appear as a result of the indefatigable efforts made by him all his life and thanks to the immortal exploits he performed by bringing a bright future of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 All the servicepersons and people took an oath from the bottom of their hearts, paying the last revolutionary respects to the leader.
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il, do believe us.
					
					We will defend with our lives the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un in any storm and stress. 
					
					 We will accomplish the cause of building a thriving socialist nation, the behest of Kim Jong Il, like disciples of President Kim Il Sung, remaining loyal to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Condolence Message from Mauritanian President
articles.content:
Condolence Message from Mauritanian President

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Dec. 19 received a condolatory message from Mauritanian President Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 I learnt the news in deepest grief that HE Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, passed away.
					
					 At this heartbreaking moment I express deepest condolences to you and the Korean people.

articles.title: Condolence Message from Sudanese President
articles.content:
Condolence Message from Sudanese President

					Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Sudanese President Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir on Dec. 19.
					
					 He said in the message that he received the sad news of the demise of leader Kim Jong Il with a heavy heart.
					
					 He, on the behalf of the government and people of Sudan and on his own behalf, expressed the deepest condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Condolence Message from Senegalese President
articles.content:
Condolence Message from Senegalese President

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Abdoulaye Wade, president of Senegal, on December 26.
					
					 In the message the president, on behalf of the Senegalese people and on his own, expressed deep condolences and sympathy to Kim Jong Un and the fraternal Korean people on the sad news that Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, passed away.

articles.title: Condolence Message from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Condolence Message from Ugandan President

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of condolences from Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni on December 20.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 It is with profound shock and deep sorrow that we learnt of the death of HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the DPRK, on December 17, 2011.
					
					 His contribution to the achievement of Uganda's development is immense.
					
					 At this moment of grief, I wish on behalf of the people and government of Uganda and on my own behalf to convey our heartfelt condolences to Your Excellency, the bereaved family and the people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Condolence Message from President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Condolence Message from President of Sao Tome and Principe

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a condolence message from Manuel Pinto Da Costa, president of Sao Tome and Principe, on Dec. 19.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 Upon hearing the sad news of the demise of His Excellency Chairman Kim Jong Il, I, on behalf of the people of Sao Tome and Principe and on my own, express deepest condolences and solidarity to Your Excellency and through you to the Korean people in bitter sorrow at this time.

articles.title: Condolence Message from Director General of ITAR-TASS
articles.content:
Condolence Message from Director General of ITAR-TASS

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a condolatory message from Vitaly Ignatenko, general director of the ITAR-TASS, over the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The general director expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I would never forget the great feats performed by Kim Jong Il for the development of the friendly relations between Russia and the DPRK, he noted, adding:
					
					 The answers he gave to the questions put by the ITAR-TASS in 2001 and 2011 evoked great response throughout the world.
					
					 The demise of Kim Jong Il is an irrevocable loss to all the officials of the ITAR-TASS, he said, noting staff members of the ITAR-TASS are sharing sorrow with Kim Jong Un and the Korean people.
					
					 Though Kim Jong Il passed away, he will be always remembered by them, he stressed.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean President Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean President Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The president of the House of Representatives of Equatorial Guinea paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in the country on Dec. 26 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He observed a moment's silence before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and made an entry in the mourners' book.
					
					 The House of Representatives of Equatorial Guinea expresses deep condolences to the Korean people and extends sincere solidarity to the DPRK, he wrote.
					
					 He prayed for the immortality of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Nepalese Authorized by President Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Nepalese Authorized by President Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Nepalese President Ram Baran Yadav expressed deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Authorized by the president, the secretary of the President's Secretariat visited the DPRK embassy in Katmandu on December 26 and observed a moment's silence before the portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that in the demise of leader Kim Jong Il the Nepalese people lost a close friend and this is the greatest loss to the two peoples.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would successfully carry forward and accomplish the cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il under the leadership of respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kuwaiti Authorized by Emir Visits DPRK Emba
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Authorized by Emir Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Kuwaiti Emir Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah expressed deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Upon the authorization of the emir, the acting minister for the Emir's Office on Dec. 26 visited the DPRK embassy and observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed deep condolences to the DPRK government and people on the demise of Kim Jong Il on behalf of the emir and his heir and the Kuwaiti government and people.

articles.title: Egyptian Authorized by PM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Egyptian Authorized by PM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Egyptian Prime Minister Kamal El Ganzouri expressed condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Authorized by the prime minister, the vice foreign minister for Asia visited the DPRK embassy in Cairo on December 25 to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He laid a floral basket before the portrait of Kim Jong Il on behalf of the prime minister and expressed condolences.
					
					 He, on behalf of the prime minister, expressed condolences to the government and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed the conviction that the Korean people would overcome sorrow and sufferings under the guidance of their leadership.

articles.title: Party Leaders of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Party Leaders of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- V.V. Zhirinovsky, chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, and Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party, and members of its Leadership paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassies on Dec. 27 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They expressed condolences before portraits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Expressing deep condolences on behalf of the Party, V.V. Zhirinovsky said they are sure that the line of Kim Jong Il would be steadily carried forward under the guidance of Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 Gyula Thurmer stressed that his party would do its best to extend support and solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people at this difficult time.
					
					 Meanwhile, a delegation of the Revolutionary Party of Tanzania on Dec. 22 visited the DPRK mission to express condolences.

articles.title: Cubans Visit DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Cubans Visit DPRK Embassies

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Personages of different circles in Cuba visited the DPRK embassy in Havana on Dec. 21 and 22 to mourn the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were Alvaro Lopez Miera, first vice-minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces and chief of the General Staff of the Revolutionary Armed Forces, and its vice-ministers; Marcos Rodriguez, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs; Oscar Martinez, deputy head of the International Department of the C.C., Communist Party; Orlando Hernandez, first vice-minister of Trade and Foreign Investment; the president of the Prensa Latina News Agency; Juan Vela Valdes, chairman of the Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification; Juan Jose Leon Vega, chairman of the Cuban preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung; President Kenia Serrano Puig and Vice-President Alicia Corredera of the Institute of Friendship with the Peoples; Alfonso Fraga Perez, secretary general of the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia, and Latin America; and officials of the Committee for Defense of the Revolution, the Union of Young Communists, th
					
					 e military, friendship organizations and press organs.
					
					 They laid wreaths, bouquets and flowers before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid a silent tribute to him.
					
					 Meanwhile Cuban ambassadors to Russia, Germany, Italy, India, Malaysia, Guinea, Uganda and Peru paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassies in those countries between Dec. 19 and 22.

articles.title: French Personages Visit DPRK Mission
articles.content:
French Personages Visit DPRK Mission

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- French personages visited the DPRK mission to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. Among them were General Secretary of the Central Committee of the French Revolutionary Communist League Jean Luc Sale and its international secretaries, the member of the National Council of French Communist Party, Senator Jean-Claude Frecon, chairman of the French Group for the Study of the DPRK, Andre Aubry, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, and chairmen of its regional committees, Edmond Jouve, director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, and its Councillor Lyne Sinyodyium, advisor in charge of French foreign trade and other personages of different circles.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Jean Luc Sale wrote in the mourners' book that he believed the Korean people would build a thriving nation true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Diplomatic Envoys and Int'l Bodies DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Diplomatic Envoys and Int'l Bodies DPRK Embassies

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries and personages of international bodies mourned the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ambassadors and charges d'affaires a.i. of different countries to Russia, Laos, Iran, Cambodia, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Thailand, Singapore, Libya, South Africa, Uganda, Mexico, Bulgaria, Uzbekistan, Austria, Switzerland, Sweden, Germany and Italy paid consolatory visits to the DPRK embassies between Dec. 20 and 27.
					
					 Diplomatic envoys of various countries to UN Office and international bodies at Geneva and personages of the WHO and the WIPO paid condolatory visits to the DPRK permanent mission between Dec. 21 and 26. 
					
					 Among them were diplomatic envoys of Cuba, Syria, Mongolia, Singapore, Indonesia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Algeria, Tanzania, Australia, Belarus, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan.
					
					 The Egyptian and Venezuelan ambassadors to Vietnam, the Lao ambassador to Mongolia, the Egyptian ambassador to Nepal, the Burkina Faso ambassador to Nigeria and the Guinea-Bissau and Ghanaian ambassadors and the Sierra Leone charge d'affaires a.i. to Guinea, too, paid condolatory visits to DPRK embassies.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Vatican ambassador to Uganda and the representative of the League of Arab States to India paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassies and the Liberian mission in Rome sent a note to the DPRK mission.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign personages paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in their countries on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il from December 19 to 26.
					
					 They included the secretary of the Donggang City Committee of the Communist Party of China, the mayor of the Donggang City People's Government, the director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Heilongjiang Provincial People's Government of China, families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, the administrative governor of Altanbolag County, Tov Province of Mongolia, the president of the Academy of Social Science of Vietnam, the minister of Prime Minister's Office, the advisor to the foreign minister and the political secretary of the Foreign Ministry of Thailand, the chairman of the Iran-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, the chairman of the Tehran City Committee of the Iranian Workers' House, members of the Leadership of the People's Action Party of Singapore, the director of the Nepalese Agricultural Development Bank,  the chairman of the Socialist Journalist Forum of Nepal, the director general for Administrative Affairs of the Union of Myanma
					
					 r Economic Holdings Limited, the deputy director general of the General Kuwait Fund For Arab Economic Development, the chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, the chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, the international secretary of the Communist Party of Sweden, the vice-chairman of the British-DPRK All-Party Parliamentary Group, the chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the directors of the Ministry of Agriculture and Ministry of Health in Zamfara State of Nigeria, the financial director of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry and Tourism in Yobe State of Nigeria, a member of the Political Bureau of the National Progressive Unionist Party of Egypt, the director of the Secretariat of the Ministry of Culture and Art of Congo, a spokesman for the Political Bureau of the Congolese Socialist Party and the chairman of the Congolese National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					  They left wreaths and bouquets before portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 The secretary of the Donggang City Committee of the Communist Party of China said that the citizens in Donggang City deeply revere Kim Jong Il. We will turn sorrow into strength together with the Korean people and devote all efforts to promote the prosperity of the two countries, he added. 
					
					 The chairman of the Iran-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, hoping that the Korean people would turn the sorrow into strength and courage and achieve the success in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The director of the above-said Nepalese bank said that the sad news of the demise of Kim Jong Il brought the people and followers of the Juche idea of Nepal the greatest sorrow. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il was the great leader recognized by the world, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy stressed that Kim Jong Il who victoriously led the cause of independence against imperialism under the uplifted banner of Songun would always live in the hearts of mankind.

articles.title: Personages of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Personages of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Personages of various countries paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions between Dec. 20 and 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the Mongolian minister of Defence; the financial secretary of the Central Executive Committee of the People's Party, the speaker of the Sind State Assembly, the secretary to the Foreign Ministry and the director general of its General Administration of East Asia and Pacific Affairs and the chairman of the Association for Self-Reliance Studies in Pakistan; the director general of the General Administration of East Asia Affairs of the Foreign Ministry, the chairman of the Federation of Chinese and the general manger of the Yang Tzi Cruise and Tour SDN.BHD. of Malaysia; a senior minister, the secretary of State of the Ministry of Information, deputy general secretaries of the Norodom Ranariddh Party, the director general of the AKP of Cambodia; the acting director of the Regional Bureau for Asia and Pacific of the Uzbek Foreign Ministry.
					
					 The visitors laid wreaths and bunches of flowers before the portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid a silent tribute to him.
					
					 Also the government ministries, institutions, diplomatic missions and personages of different countries paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions.
					
					 Among them were the Togolese Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, the General Political Bureau of the San Marino Foreign Ministry, missions of the Foreign Ministry of Russia to Ulan-Ude and Khabarovsk, the Swiss permanent mission to the United Nations, the Russian and Saharan and Vietnamese embassies in Mexico, the Luxemburg embassy in London and the president of the Socialist Party of Benin.

articles.title: Koreans in Uzbekistan Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Koreans in Uzbekistan Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan visited the DPRK embassy in Tashkent on December 26 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included officials of Koreans' organizations in Uzbekistan, heads of Koreans' art troupes and Koreans in Tashkent Region.
					
					 They laid wreaths and bunches of flowers before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 They mourned in the humblest reverence the demise of Kim Jong Il who devoted himself to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people all his life.

articles.title: Koreans in China Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Koreans in China Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Korean residents in China on a visit to the motherland expressed deep condolences before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and at the mourning stations.
					
					 Ri Hwa Son left a wreath before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il in Manpho City and said as follows in tears:
					
					 His unexpected demise was such a great shock to me that the sky and the earth seemed to collapse.
					
					 It was unbelievable to me, indeed.
					
					 I will overcome this sorrow and work harder for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Choe Kil Ryong said that he was so excited whenever he watched Kim Jong Il on TV giving tireless field guidance to the units of the Korean People's Army, factories and farms. 
					
					 I would strive to build a thriving nation true to the behest of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, Choe added.
					
					 Kim Jong Ok said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il's passing was sadder than the news that the sun stopped shining.
					
					 Although he passed away, he would be alive in the hearts of the Koreans in China.
					
					 Li Pyong Ryol visited Kim Jong Il's smiling portrait in Kanggye City to express condolences and said:
					
					 All the Koreans writhed in grief at the loss of a peerlessly great man.
					
					 I keenly felt the ties of kinship between the leader and its people.
					
					 He will be remembered as the great father of the nation.

articles.title: Young Koreans Brace Themselves Up in Mourning Days
articles.content:
Young Koreans Brace Themselves Up in Mourning Days

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The young Korean people, stricken with grief at the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, are resolved to convert their sorrow into strength and courage and unfailingly materialize his plan for building a thriving nation.
					
					 According to data available, about 400,000 young men and women had joined in shock-brigade activities in major economic sectors and distinguished themselves in production and construction in seven days since the news of his passing away was reported on December 19. During the days, nearly 800,000 young people volunteered to do difficult and toilsome jobs.  
					
					 Some 80,000 young people in the light industrial sector have fulfilled their daily quotas at 139 percent on an average, while more than 267,000 young peasants turned out some 843 800 tons of compost in a few days.
					
					 Meanwhile, some 2,000 young workers in power stations have made a big contribution to boosting electric power output through collective innovations. 
					
					 More than 32,000 young coal miners produced 157,000 tons of coal as of Monday.
					
					 Young railway workers, including nearly 500 at the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, finished repairing some 150 locomotives and 260 passenger and freight cars.
					
					 Such achievements have also been reported from the construction of the Mt. Paektu Songun Youth Power Station and northern railway reconstruction.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always Live in Hearts of Koreans
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always Live in Hearts of Koreans

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of the Korean people and progressive humankind of the world and he will find himself at all times among the participants in the general onward march advancing full of confidence under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Papers here Wednesday say this in editorials as regards a solemn ceremony of bidding last farewell to Kim Jong Il taking place here today.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun notes that the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il was one of a great successor who set an example of the times in materializing ideas of the preceding leader and accomplishing his cause.
					
					 It was the noble life of a peerless patriot who carved out a rosy future of Kim Il Sung's Korea through his tireless dedication to the country and its people and an immortal life of a world political elder and an outstanding leader who steered the cause of human independence and the cause of socialism to victory, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il always lives in the hearts of the Korean people and army and humankind with the great revolutionary idea indicating the road ahead of the times and history.
					
					 It was thanks to his revolutionary idea, Songun idea that the servicepersons and people of the DPRK could firmly maintain the lifeline of the Juche revolution despite the worst trials and demonstrate the dignity of the country as an invincible political and ideological power and a matchless military power before the world.
					
					 He always lives with the revolutionary cause of the popular masses and the socialist cause which make steady victories along the orbit of independence.
					
					 He provided the unbreakable single-minded unity of the party, army and people and a mainstay for defending the country and achieving its prosperity like a powerful war deterrent. This helped the DPRK win victory after victory in the fierce confrontation with the imperialist allied forces and the final victory of Korean-style socialism. This is the world-startling miracle and the great victory of Kim Jong Il's politics.
					
					 He is immortal thanks to the inseparable ties of kindred with the Korean people.
					
					 His love for the Korean people is shining as the warmest and devoted love of a father hard to find in human history.
					
					 Minju Joson stresses that he will always stand in the van of the Korean revolution making steady progress and his august name and tender-hearted image as bright as the sun will shine long with the eternal prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Legacy of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Legacy of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary legacy of leader Kim Jong Il is people, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a political essay. It declares his immortality at this moment when the descendants of Kim Il Sung's nation are parting with him, sending off 2011 in grief.
					
					 The essay says:
					
					 Kim Jong Il performed immense ideological and theoretical feats and built lots of edifices on this land and left rich cultural treasures.
					
					 The DPRK has been dignified as a country that manufactured and launched artificial satellites and accessed nukes.
					
					 It effected industrial revolution in the new century, promising the bright future of the nation in the era of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 Kim Jong Il encouraged the ranks seized with tears and grief following the demise of President Kim Il Sung to turn out for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Thanks to these legacies we do not worry about the destiny of ourselves and posterity at this time of national mourning.
					
					 Kim Jong Il left nothing for himself. He devoted his life and happiness to the revolution.
					
					 To serve the people had been the life maxim that had been steadily carried forward in the revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and it was also philosophy of an uninterrupted revolution of the revolutionary family of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 People precisely means Kim Jong Il's revolutionary legacy and people signifies his immortality.
					
					 Supreme leader of our party and people Kim Jong Un takes warm care of the people left by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Every moment of Kim Jong Un's life is replete with loving care and solicitude for the people.
					
					 May Kim Jong Il bless the DPRK bright future with his eternal beaming smile.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on Dec. 26 made public a condolatory statement on the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Solidarity expresses heartfelt condolences on the untimely demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, the statement said.
					
					 Extending deepest condolences and sympathy to the compatriots in the north, it hoped that they would convert bitter grief into strength and courage to dynamically advance.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Move to Take Legal Action against South Korean
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Move to Take Legal Action against South Korean

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Hwang Hye Ro, co-representative of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy in south Korea, paid a condolatory visit to the north to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In this regard, the south Korean authorities are going to take a legal action against Hwang on charge of violation of the notorious "National Security Law".
					
					 According to the south Korean CBS on December 26, the prosecution is claiming that Hwang's unlicensed visit to Pyongyang is a violation of the law.
					
					 Moreover, it is going to impose a harsh penalty upon her on charge of violation of the law, even taking issue with her visit to the north to take part in the August 15 Pan National Festival for Reunification in 1999 as a representative of the south Korean Federation of University Students Council under the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance of Youth and Students for Korea's Reunification.
					
					 The Korean nation will surely judge the unethical fascist action of the puppet group of traitors to unreasonably block the condolatory visits of south Korean organizations to Pyongyang.

articles.title: S. Korean Univ. Students Protest Blocking Mourning Visit
articles.content:
S. Korean Univ. Students Protest Blocking Mourning Visit

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century held a press conference outside the "governmental" building on Tuesday at which it protested against the puppet authorities' actions to block NGOs' condolatory visits to the north.
					
					 Speakers at the press conference held that the authorities are not expressing official condolences over the great loss of the nation and, moreover, taking such unethical actions as disallowing condolatory visits of NGOs, further straining the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 They declared they would visit the north to express sympathy over the passing of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il in order to implement the joint declarations and achieve peaceful reunification of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 They urged the "government" to take measures for students' condolatory visits, warning it would be the last opportunity for the authorities for mending the fences with the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Allow Mourning Visit
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Allow Mourning Visit

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea Tuesday issued a statement urging the authorities to allow condolence visit to Pyongyang on the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Now the whole world is expressing deep condolences on the passing of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, the statement said, adding:
					
					 In south Korea, too, organizations of different circles are applying for visit to the north to mourn his demise one after another and the mourning atmosphere is running high.
					
					 This is the elementary etiquette to be kept as fellow countrymen, but the authorities only are hindering condolence visit. It is an improper deed in view of ethics and morality or the present state of the south-north relations.
					
					 The statement demanded that the authorities promptly allow any condolence visit by civilians and come out to pay condolatory visit to the north after expressing condolences on behalf of the "government".

articles.title: American Regional Seminar Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
American Regional Seminar Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- American regional Internet seminar on the theme of "Vitality of President Kim Il Sung's Idea in 21st Century" was held in Lima, Peru on Dec. 24 and 25.
					
					 The Internet seminar opened by an American regional preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung carried a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung on its special page. 
					
					 Participants in the seminar included personages of political parties and organizations in Peru, Brazil, Venezuela, Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia, Dominica, Ecuador and the American regional preparatory committee.
					
					 They observed a moment's silence in memory of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The secretary general of the preparatory committee, making an opening address, said the untimely passing of Kim Jong Il is the greatest sadness to the Korean people and the world progressives. 
					
					 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, expressed deep sympathy over the passing of Kim Jong Il in his keynote report. 
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, Andres Gasca Sanchez, president of the Mexican Fellowship Institute to Honor the Memory of President Kim Il Sung, and Felix Fernandes Torres, secretary general of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and other speakers took the floor. 
					
					 They stressed that the Korean people would surely build a thriving nation under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Costa Rican Party Leader Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Costa Rican Party Leader Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Humberto Vargas Carbonel, general secretary of the C.C., People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, made public a statement on Dec. 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The passing of Kim Jong Il is the greatest loss to the Korean revolution and the world revolution and the great misfortune and bitterest grief to all the Korean people, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The great Comrade Kim Jong Il performed immortal revolutionary exploits for accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche, prosperity of socialist Korea, happiness of the people, national reunification and global independence.
					
					 He honorably defended the gains of socialism, valuable legacy of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung, with his Songun politics, all-powerful treasured sword, toward the end of the last century and turned the DPRK into an invincible politico-ideological and military power based on single-minded unity.
					
					 He energetically conducted external activities for victory of the socialist cause, world peace and stability and friendship and solidarity among the peoples, holding high the banner of independence against imperialism all his life, and thus remarkably raised the DPRK's position and prestige in the international arena.
					
					 Though he passed away, he laid a strong political and military foundation for the Korean revolution to advance generation after generation.

articles.title: Kuwaiti Organizations Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Organizations Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The Kuwaiti preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Kuwait-DPRK Friendship Association jointly issued a bulletin on Dec. 23 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The bulletin in its preface expressed deepest condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In an article titled "Brilliant Commander and Powerful Army" the bulletin said:
					
					 Though the great leader HE Kim Jong Il passed away, the future of the DPRK is rosy as it is guided by HE Kim Jong Un, the great brilliant commander.
					
					 The Korean People's Army will always show its might as an army capable of defeating any formidable enemy.

articles.title: British Party Organ Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
British Party Organ Mourns Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Morning Star, an organ of the Communist Party of Britain, on Dec. 23 carried an article with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il on his demise. The article was contributed in the joint name of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy.
					
					 Under the title of "In Memory of Comrade Kim Jong Il, great leader of Korean people and world socialism" the article said:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il was an outstanding thinker-theoretician and a man of action.
					
					 As the faithful successor to the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung, he worked energetically for the Korean people and died in train on his way of field guidance tour for the building of a thriving nation and the improvement of the standard of people's living.
					
					 The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy are sharing sorrow with the Korean people over his demise.
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il will always live in our hearts.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Organizations and personages of different countries issued statements on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Solidarity with Peoples in a statement on Dec.19 noted the demise of Kim Jong Il who led the struggle for socialism and independence against imperialism brought pain of great loss to the world people.
					
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in a statement on Dec. 20, said progressive humankind lost the greatest man and the most prominent and excellent leader.
					
					 Though he passed away, he will always live as an incarnation of bravery and greatness and as the Songun leader of the world, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the committee for technical instruction for custom-built construction projects of Equatorial Guinea noted he heard with great sorrow the sad news of the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed the most profound condolences to the Korean people in bitter sorrow over the great loss.

articles.title: Guinean Broadcasting Services Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Guinean Broadcasting Services Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The Guinean Domestic Broadcasting Service aired a program on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il on Dec. 24.
					
					 It said: HE Kim Jong Il devoted all his life to the inheritance and accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung and worked day and night for the prosperity of socialist Korea, happiness of the people, reunification of the country and global independence.
					
					 He was a prominent thinker and theoretician and peerless political elder who led the Korean people to victory with his profound ideologies and theories and extraordinary leadership and a peerless patriot and father of the people possessed of warm love for the country and its people.
					
					 His untimely demise is the greatest loss and sorrow to all the Korean people.
					
					 The Guinean people share this sorrow with the Korean people. 
					
					 The Guinean International Broadcasting Service and the Seven National Languages Broadcasting Service aired the same program that day.

articles.title: Memorial Services Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Memorial Services Held in Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- A memorial service was held in Russia on Dec. 24 under the sponsorship of Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It was attended by members of the Friendship Association, the Movement for Supporting the Army and the Russian Veterans Fund. 
					
					Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the friendship association, said that Kim Jong Il's life was the one of the great man who devoted himself to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people, adding that his demise was a bitter loss to the world progressives.
					
					 Memorial services were also held in Nepal and Mongolia on Dec. 25.
					
					 They were attended by personages of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), the New Front of the People's Republic of Nepal, the Constituent Assembly, the Ministry of Land  Reform and Management of the Nepal Government, the Study Forum for Self－Reliance of Nepal, the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal, those of the College of Culture of Mongolia and masses.
					
					The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The memorial service in Nepal adopted a message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Committees to Mourning Demise Formed in Belarus, Ukraine
articles.content:
Committees to Mourning Demise Formed in Belarus, Ukraine

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- Committees were inaugurated in Belarus and Ukraine on Dec. 23 and 26 to mourn the passing of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					V. Chikin, chairman of the Permanent Standing Committee of the Belarus-DPRK National Friend Association Named after Kim Il Sung, was elected chairman of the committee in Belarus. 
					
					 Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the committee in Ukraine. 
					
					 The two committees decided to set a mourning period that ends on Thursday and stage colorful activities in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Lauded by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Lauded by British Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 28 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on December 22 on the 94th anniversary of birth of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk is a model woman revolutionary to be followed by the world progressive women, the statement said.
					
					 She, infinitely faithful to President Kim Il Sung who is the sun of the Korean nation, regarded it as her noblest mission to ensure his safety at the cost of her life, it noted, adding:
					
					 She taught valuable truth that women should turn out in the revolutionary struggle, not cooping themselves up only in their homes.
					
					 She brought up leader Kim Jong Il to be a great revolutionary and leader of the DPRK.

articles.title: Se despiden de Kim Jong Il a lo largo de avenidas de mas de 40 kilometros
articles.content:
Se despiden de Kim Jong Il a lo largo de avenidas de mas de 40 kilometros

					Pyongyang, 28 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El dia 28, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y los habitantes coreanos con el mas sentido pesame se despidieron del fallecido Dirigente        Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 Las calles capitalinas de mas de 40 kilometros estaban llenas de millones de habitantes muy entristecidos. 
					
					  Los oficiales y soldados del EPC, los obreros, campesinos, intelectuales, jovenes y estudiantes, asi como los amigos extranjeros de visita en Corea esperaban el momento historico bajo la nieve que caia como lagrimas del cielo por el deceso del gran hombre. 
					
					  Mientras se interpretaba con solemnidad la "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il", inmortal himno revolucionario, el convoy funerario del Dirigente partio de la explanada frente al Palacio Memorial Kumsusan y entro en la encrucijada de Ryonghung. 
					
					  Encabezaba el convoy el automovil, en que iba instalado el gran retrato del Dirigente con amplia sonrisa, seguido del carro cargado de una gran ofrenda floral a nombre del vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Al ver la imagen del Dirigente, las masas rompieron a sollozar con tanta tristeza. 
					
					 Avanzaba despacio tambien el carro que llevaba encima el feretro del Dirigente que estaba entre las flores y cubierto de la bandera del PTC. 
					
					Por detras, venia el convoy en que viajaban los miembros de la comision funeraria estatal. 
					
					Los funcionarios, los obreros, los campesinos, los intelectuales y los jovenes y estudiantes comenzaron a lanzar gemidos dando punetazos en el suelo. 
					
					Los llantos se hacian cada vez mas fuertes por el creciente dolor de haber perdido al padre de la nacion quien visitaba sin interrupcion los puestos militares en el frente avanzado y todos los lugares habitados por el pueblo considerandolos como su despacho y fallecio en el tren en pleno viaje de trabajo. 
					
					La estela de pesar se hizo mas profunda en la explanada frente a la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril.
					
					La multitud clamaba el retorno del Dirigente gritando que nunca habian pensado en Pyongyang y la Corea socialista sin el. 
					
					Cuando el convoy funerario entro en la Plaza Jonsung, lo acogieron los oficiales y soldados de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas del EPC, los cadetes de la Academia Militar General Kim Il Sung, el Instituto Superior Politico Kim Il Sung y otras escuelas politico-militares a todos los niveles, y los alumnos de la Escuela Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae. 
					
					Los oficiales y soldados del EPC, entristecidos por el deceso del Dirigente, que realizo imborrables proezas por la construccion del ejercito como fuerzas revolucionarias de flor y nata para el partido y el lider, se despidieron de el con las gorras militares en la mano rindiendole el maximo tributo. 
					
					Tomaron la decision de apoyar con las armas la direccion de Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente del PTC y del pueblo coreano. 
					
					A su paso por la encrucijada de Mansugyo, el convoy fue recibido por los uniformados del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea y los oficiales del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo. 
					
					El convoy funeral dio vuelta por la via circular de la Puerta Pothong y siguio hacia la avenida Chollima. 
					
					Un anciano salio de la multitud y exclamo asi desplomandose al suelo: 
					
					"General, esta llorando el pueblo de todo el pais. El pueblo tenia ganas de llevarlo a cuestas para que usted se repusiera de la fatiga acumulada en la marcha forzada".
					
					El convoy entro en la Puente Tongsong. 
					
					En su retrato, el Dirigente estaba vestido en su chaqueta modesta como si quisiera realizar una visita de orientacion. 
					
					Al ver ese retrato, la calle se ha convertido en un instante en un mar de lagrimas. 
					
					El convoy paso por delante de altas viviendas y se dirigio a la encrucijada de Phyongchon donde hay muchas fabricas y empresas importantes. 
					
					La tierra se tiembla de llantos de las personas que despiden del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quien continuo su camino de direccion diciendo que se sentia mejor cuando estaba  junto con el pueblo.
					
					Mas de 100 mil habitantes alineadas a lo largo de la avenida desde el puente Chungsong hasta llegar a la entrada del puente Rangnang se despidieron del convoy funerario recordando aquellos dias en que recibian el amor y la confianza del Dirigente.
					
					El convoy paso por la avenida Munsu envuelta de la tristeza en medio de la melodia tragica de la banda militar.
					
					Los trabajadores de diversos estratos aglomerados en la explanada frente al Monumento a la Fundacion del Partido, levantado majestuosamente, se sentian afligidos despidiendo al Dirigente.
					
					El convoy atraveso la puente Okryu y entro en la Plaza Kim Il Sung, donde rompieron en llantos mirando la imagen del Dirigente generoso y benevolo los diputados a la Asamblea Popular Suprema, los heroes del Trabajo, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los benemeritos y los funcionarios de los ministerios y organos centrales, parados en el area reservada para los invitados, y la multitud que llenaba la plaza. 
					
					Los huespedes extranjeros tambien expresaron profundas condolencias entristecidos por haber perdido al gran maestro de la humanidad. 
					
					Al frente del Gran Teatro de Pyongyang, numerosos trabajadores de diversos estratos acogieron muy afligidos el carro funeral del Dirigente.
					
					Los llantos de las personas sacudian la tierra y el cielo. 
					
					El convoy funerario paso por la falda de la colina Moran anegada de lagrimas de tristeza.
					
					Al pasar por el Arco de Triunfo, la muchedumbre despedia con tristes lagrimas al Dirigente           , mientras se deciden a construir cuanto antes sobre este territorio patrio el Estado prospero deseado tanto por el Presidente y el Dirigente.
					
					El convoy funeral paso por la avenida de al lado del Monumento a la Amistad y la encrucijada de Ryonghung y avanzo hacia el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan. 
					
					El pueblo coreano ha recibido con gran emocion las instrucciones dada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il formulando votos por el futuro de la patria.
					
					Sera maravilloso el futuro de la patria y nacion coreana porque cuenta con el General Kim Jong Un.

					  Parados ante el cuerpo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, los participantes en la ceremonia de condolencias guardaron un momento de silencio expresando los sentimientos de gran pesar.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun menciona herencia revolucionaria de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun menciona herencia revolucionaria de Kim Jong Il

					Pyongyang, 28 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Los descendientes de la nacion de Kim Il Sung pasan con mucho pesar el ano 2011 y declaran la inmortalidad del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en estos momentos de despedida.
					
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario politico divulgado el dia 28 y prosigue:
					
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il alcanzo enormes hazanas ideo-teoricas, levanto en la tierra patria numerosas creaciones monumentales y dejo en la historia abundantes patrimonios culturales.
					
					  Pese al gran duelo nacional que sufre de nuevo despues del fallecimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el pueblo coreano no se preocupa de su destino y el de las generaciones venideras.
					
					Es que la RPDC emergio como digno pais fabricante y lanzador de satelite artificial y portador de arma nuclear, inicio la revolucion industrial del nuevo siglo con que se puede dar un gran salto en la era de economia basada en intelectualidad y cuenta con la fuerza espiritual de la nacion coreana que convirtio la oleada de lagrimas y sangre en el torrente hacia el Estado prospero.
					
					 El Dirigente no dejo nada para si mismo y ofrendo toda su vida y felicidad por la revolucion.
					
					  Para el pueblo, esto es el fundamento de la vida, que continua vigente en la historia revolucionaria del Presidente y el Dirigente  y la filosofia de la revolucion continua de la familia revolucionaria del monte Paektu.
					
					  La palabra "pueblo" significa la herencia revolucionaria del Dirigente y su eterna vida.
					
					  Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente de nuestro partido y pueblo, abrazo al pueblo que le ha dejado        Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Dirigente Kim Jong Il, 
					
					!Bendiga el futuro maravilloso de Corea con su eterna sonrisa del Sol!
